overview_of_class: Chemistry 210-1 treats concepts fundamental to the study of organic chemistry, including structure, stereochemistry and reactivity. The chemistry of alkanes, alkenes, alkynes and alcohols is discussed in some detail as well.
name: Organic Chemistry
title: WCAS CHEM 210-1-23 Organic Chemistry
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Students must have completed either Chem 103 and 123, or Chem 172 and 182, with a C- or better to register for this course.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Chemistry 210-1 treats concepts fundamental to the study of organic chemistry, including structure, stereochemistry and reactivity. The chemistry of alkanes, alkenes, alkynes and alcohols is discussed in some detail as well.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisite: Grade of C- or better in Chemistry 103-0/123-0 or Chemistry 171-0/181-0 or equivalent transfer credit.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
1. Organic Chemistry, 8th Edition, by L.G. Wade, Pearson ($144.20 new, looseleaf)***

2. Turning Technologies Response Card Model QT or NXT ("Clicker") and associated 1 year license ($55.00 new; $44 used)***

***Prices as listed by the Northwestern Norris Bookstore (4/4/17). Course materials may be available from other vendors at lower price.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value:
1. Solutions for Organic Chemistry, 8th Edition, Jan Simek, Pearson ($236.15 new; $177.10 used)***

2. Molecular Modeling Kit ($41.15 new; $30.85 used)***

***Prices as listed by the Northwestern Norris Bookstore (4/4/17). Course materials may be available from other vendors at lower price.

class_attributes:
Natural Sciences Distro Area

Attendance at 1st class mandatory
subject: CHEM
